wAi53Q9rPBjLnUf0yROimw.text: Visited this place with a friend for a first meeting.  So we felt this might be an appropriate Fancy-ish place.  Upon entering the nearly empty resturaunt, we were asked if we had a reservation. No. We were walk ups.  They seated us just fine.   Our waiter seemed a little.. lost?  We placed our order - started with Coconut Shrimp. For $12.00 I certainly thought we'd get more than 4. Alas I should ask rather than think.  I then ordered a wedge salad, which was amazing.  We did order a Beer, but rather than it coming right out, it seemed to take a while, and was finally delivered with the apology of the keg being changed.   When our meals came out, Mine the parmesan crusted chicken and his the fish and chips, were satisfactory, save we had to ask for the tarter sauce, since his fish and chips were served with cocktail sauce, again, very strange.  The food was tasty, the chicken was cooked well, and the sides were yummy.   The prices were .. a bit out of range for what we got, and the service. They were very VERY interested on pressing me into getting the rewards card, even after letting them know that I was from out of state.

Kpwg5vgHRfNO5ds_GJiVPg.text: What a disappointment... Our waitress was MIA most of the night. Our drink order took over 15 minutes. Our salad came prior to our appetizer and the appetizer was cold when it finally did arrive. My wife's dinner was cold and my was under cooked. Only reason we went is that we had a gift card. Never again.

salsgmQbZahd8H8L2B-eHg.text: Great happy hour spot! They have drink and food specials for happy hour and outdoor seating! I had a Manhattan and a tuna poke bowl which were both included in the happy hour promotion. The tuna poke bowl was the best I've had in the city. It's a small dish so not big enough for a whole dinner but great for snacking on while enjoying happy hour drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuna poke

boyoITsZE3tVY44avsagnQ.text: I went with a friend before the Cirque du Soleil show, and when we got there the restaurant was not busy.  We were seated immediately, we got there early for our reservation.  The server came by quickly and asked us what we wanted to drink and what our dinner order would be, which, of course we didn't know because we had just sat down.  We ordered a bottle of wine because a single glass was $18, and he spilled it on the table with each glass he poured, not sure why as the bottle was fine when I poured.  We ordered then and that was the last time we saw him until he asked if we wanted dessert. I requested bread from another server passing by because none was brought or offered by our server.  I got the bourbon glazed salmon and it was fine as long as I scraped off the offensively salty glaze.  The mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach that were the sides were good, they offset the saltiness. My friend got the burger and it was pretty good, she said.   The salmon was not worth the $30 price tag, I have had salmon prepared better at TGI Fridays.  Our server did not meet the bar of fine dining, I have gone to Eddie Merlot and been blown away by the level of service and professionalism.  That was my first time there, so at least I can say I tried it.

em3UlSMdqQuKRknzTr2z3g.text: The bar waitress informed us that they don't have happy hour when there is a sign outside advertising it. Second, I ordered a 6 oz filet, the waitress delivered a ribeye. When I asked her if it was a filet she said, I guess it is. She had no clue what the food is supposed to look like. Sorry excuse for a steakhouse

NfZOg4fJ15XwzglfyR2Z6g.text: This just about sums it up....the February monthly lunch special is Seafood Gumbo and BBQ Shrimp and Grits.  I tell the waiter I'll have that and he then asks me if I want soup with lunch.  I say, I told you I am having gumbo to which he replies he has no idea what gumbo is.  Really???  Then the grits were horrible.  Probably instant and just lukewarm, all lumpy with something like broccoli rabe (???) in it.  The shrimp were bacon wrapped and bathed in BBQ sauce.  Honestly, just a really bad "special".  The sourdough bread was good...hahaha

aX7K_26v_NbVkixGibhrYQ.text: We were out for a special holiday meal with friends. The worst experience ever!  We had reservations for 7 and were seated at 7. We ordered drinks and appetizers and a couple salads. 2 hr later we still had no food. Then the salads came before the appetizers. When our meals arrived they were mediocre at best and that is a stretch. We will never return!

2nE_Tb_51NEEHp4iTDBcww.text: The tables are so close together you can hardly fit between. Our first set of wine glasses were dirty in the outside. The server spoke with the manager and he/she gave us a complementary bottle of wine. We never saw the manager. He or she never came to check on our table or apologize for the glasses. It took a little over an hour to get our food and by the time we got our food we had 20 minutes to shove in down our throats before needing to leave for a concert. It was our first time there and probably last. What was supposed to be a relaxing evening was very stressful.

DhKgt2q4Z6xtrHh-22IhVw.text: Ordered the swordfish and the waiter came back stating they ran out of it.  So I asked for the trout instead and it was awful!!  It was tasteless and the strings beans were hard. Disappointing!

8LXlu9QV3BpNMvp-0uodFQ.text: Met a couple friends here the other day for lunch with my 10 year old. The hostess was friendly, seating us while we waited for our friends. The restaurant has a very warm and welcoming ambiance...obviously well kept. Our drink orders were quickly taken, and good service continued when our friends arrived. Our food came out quickly and was very well presented. My son ordered the large filet mignon, and devoured it. I had the salmon with a red berry compote and it was delicious. Our guests were equally pleased with their meals. Throughout the service was attentive without intruding. An excellent example of how to do restaurant service and food prep the right way, resulting in 4 happy customers, who will certainly return! Well done!

Tl0TjRgQY9_kZvDsz6M7eQ.text: We had dinner last night with another couple at McCormick and Schmick downtown. At 7:30 on Saturday evening, peak time, the restaurant was not full. That's a bad sign. We chose the downtown location because we had a couple of poor service experiences at the south side location. Our experience last night was satisfactory overall. The seafood menu is limited but adequate. Three of us had the fried shrimp and the other a shrimp trilogy, indicating that the fish offerings were unexciting, to say the least. The cocktail and wine choices were decent, with wine prices comparable to other upscale restaurants. Service was a little slow considering the partly empty room. Since they eliminated valet parking it was a little uncomfortable walking several blocks from the garage on a cold, windy night. When McCormick and Schmick opened in Pittsburgh it was one of our favorites, but the thrill is definitely gone. The upscale feel has diminished, the menu has shrunk, service has slipped, and the dining room is a little worn. It's still okay, but not what it used to be. It won't continue as is for much longer. Will it be a makeover or surrender?

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried shrimp
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp trilogy with too many green beans

iLq0N3mXTXPxGopneNesHQ.text: Took a party of 13 for a celebration dinner last night.  The restaurant assured us there would not be a problem with a group this size on a Saturday night.  At least 20 minutes late getting seated.  Once seated, the wait-staff tried extremely hard, but the restaurant was so overbooked, the staff could not keep up with drink, appetizer or meal orders.  The wait time was so long, we had to ask the restaurant to serve two in our party before the rest of the group because they had to leave a LITTLE earlier.  Some drink orders were never served and some meals were cold.  Our party would have bought more drinks, deserts etc., but it was taking so long to get served we passed.  Bottom line.  If you are going to dinner on a night when restaurants are typically busy, you might look into other options.

rkeX9sAcWbdsLLe2EtL0Cw.text: I need to start this by saying, I really wanted to be impressed... but I left feeling underwhelmed. My boyfriend and I made reservations for late Saturday evening to enjoy a nice dinner in the city. We were seated promptly- but then waited close to 10 minutes for anyone to come to our table, I had to get up and speak to the hostess/manager to find a server to order cocktails. Once we had a server- he was very prompt and quick to help, but the entire experience felt rushed. We ordered appetizers of shrimp cocktail and the lobster bisque- my soup was watered down to say the least and his shrimp cocktail was delicious, but the presentation left much to be desired. Our entrees came not too long after -  I ordered the sesame salmon and my boyfriend the surf & turf. My salmon was okay  (quite over cooked) but my mushroom risotto and Brussel sprouts were great ! My boyfriend enjoyed the lobster tail but it was almost comical how small it was. His steak was also a little over cooked but he enjoyed it and finished it. We decided we didn't want to do dessert after just not being that impressed with anything. I will say - for the price, I expected more. A more complete dining experience ! We both left feeling disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

M5-DjLrHiO8vI7BcsXKmLQ.text: If you come here for nothing else, come for the Happy Hour.  You can get a delicious and humungous cheeseburger and fries at a ridiculous price.  As in, you couldn't even go to McDonald's and get a burger and fries at this size for what they're charging.  Now, of course when you go and add in a drink, that's more, but even those are fairly reasonable selection for Happy Hour prices.  However, do note that the beers are fairly limited for  HH.  Only a couple of domestics and 2 or 3 imports; the rest are full price.   The space itself is very classy.  Lots of dark stained wood finish and high ceilings.  Service in the bar area was okay.  I don't know that I would seek it out for a sit down lunch or dinner unless it was for a business meeting (which I suspect is the majority of their clientele because they are right in the heart of the business district), but next time someone wants to go for Happy Hour, I'm in.

gYIxDGnKWBSH8-DRgZ8CRg.text: The food was... ok, but the service... The restaurant was pretty empty so they certainly weren't overworked: aside from minor gripes and the inexplicable slowness, we didn't get the complimentary bread; we didn't get spoons for our soup; we didn't get spoons for our coffee; we didn't get a pen for signing the bill. That's an impressive array of mistakes for a 50min meal.

_CJYj0eJ7INxyFT9rZpuqw.text: Meh.  There are so many solid restaurants in downtown Pittsburgh that this would be one of my last choices.  Forced to eat here for a business dinner tonight and of course nothing was outright terrible, but at the same time nothing here is truly good.  Entrees are heavy on mashed potatoes and tasteless green beans, with small cuts of fish.  Unremarkable at best.

ewT_kfpUm00p5tV6PeFTJg.text: Celebratory work happy hour?! I'm there.  This was a nice little spot right downtown that hosted a goal celebration happy hour for a few teams from our office.  The drinks were great, and the food was delicious.  We had an assortment of appetizers to split which included Coconut Shrimp with a mango sauce, Quesadillas, Stuffed Mushrooms, and Oysters.   It looked like they had a really great happy hour menu, some different food special each day of the week to go along with reasonable drink prices.  I would like to go back for dinner and check out the full menu.  The service was a little slow once the place started filling up (around 5:30-6), so make sure you order your drinks accordingly :)

zv6MHqW8eq-qRviH2U-S5A.text: Well darn. Came in here hoping to check it out as a "treat" lunch spot for myself on those days when I need a nice getaway with tablecloths. The greeter was great. I got seated at a booth by myself and realized that one of the small empty bread plates was still smeared with butter. I picked up the glass to feel sticky grit all over it. Next, I had to check out the silverware but I was afraid to look. They *looked* clean but by this point, I wasn't taking any chances.   It was a full ten minutes before the waitress came by and removed the other settings. That's when I saw all the crumbs under the placemats. Co'mon! Gross! I asked for all new silverware and glasses but the crumbs were never cleared away. I ordered a lunch special and got a bread bowl lobster and corn chowder and a small walnut salad. The salad was spectacular but the soup was fairly flavorless and had a disturbing texture. I did get fresh bread and butter - yay. The waitress did check back with me and asked me how the food was. I said the salad was delish but the soup bowl - super meh. So she brought me an entire bowl of lobster bisque which was some of the best I've ever eaten. That was much appreciated. It took a bit to get my bill and my lunch did take about 20 minutes longer than it should have but it was crowded and a sit-down restaurant.   I will have to really be starving for the soup to brave the dirty dishes again. Which means, in reality, I'll probably be back in two weeks. : ) The bisque is that good. Note: I have eaten at McCormick and Schmick's on the West Coast and this one really needs to be brought up to snuff IMHO. Too bad it's such a mixed bag. There are hardly any decent mid to high range restaurants downtown. But this is about par for course in Pittsburgh. Supposedly a "foodie" town but actually, super meh.

krfGxf4QWcDWyHXRbhNjjA.text: Let me start by saying no meal is complete without the Chocolate Bag dessert (enough for 4 people to share)! We went before a show this past weekend and it was my first time. I live near the ocean so I'd like to think I know good seafood. I was very impressed with McCormick & Schmick's. Everything tasted great, was cooked perfectly, and our server was phenomenal. Prices are a bit high for my liking (esp on the drinks), but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate Bag Dessert

WyxbYzpM_sVaKE4azfHJQw.text: My wife and I went there for dinner tonight and everything was fine (albeit a busy Mother's Day evening) until she encountered a piece of saran wrap in her mash potatoes. We brought it to the attention of our server and she asked if we wanted to talk to the manager. We said no since we thought she would have taken care of the issue. So we talked to the person who appeared to be a supervisor but he did not do anything except telling us that it won't happen again. So I spoke with the general manager. He apologized and took both of our dinners off the tab that we already paid. That's what service is all about- it precedes the food. That's why we keep going back to places like Eddie Merlots and Morton's where service reigns supreme. Kudos to Dan the general manager for doing the right thing. Food is always secondary to service.

sub4Yq894t81oAMTXFUtSw.text: This was our first stop for January 2018 Restaurant week.  Honestly - it has been my worst stop in many years of eating out (for restaurant week and not).    We had lunch time reservations (12:30p).  We had to inquire - twice to get restaurant week menus. Two of us got restaurant week 2 of us did not.  My starter was Maryland Crab soup - described as a crab vegetable soup.  This should just be described as a hearty vegetable soup.  There was no crab.  Crab shouldn't even be in the name.  The spinach salad is incredibly over-dressed.  Once our entree's came we knew this was just going to be a not so hot meal.  All of our food was cold.  I'd requested my salmon rare - it was med-well.  Mashed potatoes - cold.  One of the ladies got a salad - which should be cold - but have you ever experienced when you have cut up tomatoes and then they sit for a couple days so they are a pile of mush.  Yeah - it was gross.    Our waiter was not good.  He interjected into our conversations when he happened to come to the table while we were in conversation.  He blamed a mix up on our bills on a trainee.  He spoke to us like we were country bumpkin coming into the "big city" for lunch.    All around this meal was not good.  The service, the food, everything.  If you are going out for restaurant week - don't waste your time here.   Buyer beware.

NixajP9TczrkwASkGsKGEA.text: The saltiest steak I have had in 65 years.  Such a shame that a beautiful cut of meat was ruined.

OFbJ_ls735FVeHT9Nu0Lsw.text: I have been here once before it was a number of years ago and I thought it was fantastic.  So being back in town yesterday I thought it would be a great option for happy hour.  Yesterday I have to say; the drinks were on point but the service food and level of professionalism was a total ZERO.    The food came out to customers really quickly.  Which is usually a good sign.  Mine order too came out quickly but was ice cold.  I was never asked how my food was the entire 90 Minutes I was there.  That being said, the number of workers minimum of 4 and up to 8 that stood around the end of the bar near the restroom with nothing to do told me a clear story that customer service was not a priority but rather an endless discussion of their Halloween costumes and how they planned to get wasted.  Unprofessional for this caliber of restaurant.    From the time they took my plate, the signal I am was done, until they acknowledged I needed My check was more than 30 minutes.  I still left an 18% tip when less than 10 was deserving; but there was so few in the bar I just wanted out.    Clearly the management and leadership has left the restaurant over the last year.  It's a shame; it used to be a great professional happy hour in the downtown after work.

N1tdS7URRNkLhJ5qjd7Tzw.text: Stopped here before a show at the Benedum Theatre.  We were promptly seated without a reservation and, telling our server we had allotted an hour before our theater excursion, we had ample time to order and enjoy our dinner.  I ordered the seared scallops and my husband ordered the shrimp scampi. We did without any other accompaniments as the prices were a la carte and pricey.  We were both happy with our meals and the plating was very nice.  My scallops did come with some cooked spinach and a potato hash which were sufficient and I didn't feel I needed another side.  Our server was efficient and kept us on time for our show so I am most thankful for the experience.  The four starts vs. five stars is about price.  Very steep in price for the experience as with most places offering a-la-carte dining.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scallops
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp Scampi
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reisling, yes.

01wQIAh2aWj6o87RRcyB3g.text: A few friends and I always meet for Happy Hour on Fridays. (Sometimes Tuesdays because their fish tacos are so darn good!)  I've been there over 50 times in total.    We love it here!  I can't speak about the dining room, since I have never eaten there, but the bar is great!  Their happy hour drinks are yummy and definitely not watered down!    The staff is friendly and greets us every time we walk in.  They are attentive and work hard to make sure you are having a good time.  The bar itself is clean and the music is at the perfect volume for background music.  We love it there.

EEMYoTrxV6KQkFHNXqf8Ng.text: Service was awful. Had a waiter named Jon. Very rude to my pap. Jon rushed us to order and he didn't come over to use to refill our drinks or ask us how our food was. will not be returning to this place. I also got a steak and the steak was burnt, didn't have much taste. The shrimp tasted awful and smelled old.

HFLj4_siEpIcDbFRUPAb2w.text: We were a party of six with a 5:45 reservation for dinner before Hamilton on Saturday evening. When we arrived (on time) the restaurant was busy, but there were still empty tables. We were advised to order everything at once and quickly, because the restaurant was full. It took a little time for the server to return for our order, but we did order then.  Being a spice wimp, I asked if the Maryland style crab chowder was spicy. Our server said it was not. However, mine was too spicy for me; I couldn't eat it. It wasn't too spicy for our friend who ordered it, but she forgot to bring his, so he had to wait.... We were supposed to be at the theater at about 7:15. At 6:45 we still didn't have our entrees. (They were out of my first choice, the wahoo, so I had the glazed salmon.) At 6:50 we were told our food would be ready in 6-8 minutes.  My spouse had the mis-named stuffed salmon. (The "stuffing" sat on top of the fish.) He would have liked it better if it was hot. He thought it was okay.  My daughter likes green beans. The ones that came with her fish were too salty and oily to eat. She thought the rest of her meal was okay.  My entree was also only average: a relatively small (but large enough for me) piece of glazed salmon and a bunch of warm, wilted spinach. What you might expect at TGI Friday's or from your local freezer case. (We were never asked how well-done we liked our fish cooked, and what we received was medium-well to well done.) This restaurant has and can do better.  We didn't have time to tarry over dinner or have dessert or coffee (which we might have had, as we were also celebrating our daughter's birthday), so that we could finish at about 7:30.  Slow service. Unimpressive food. This is not what we've come to expect from this restaurant. Perhaps they were understaffed in the kitchen, as well as on the floor. Whatever the problem (and our dinners had many), I hope they fix it soon.  I hope my next review of this restaurant reflects a better experience.

-uvy1l66PgDCdqvzEsUEIw.text: The Rockefeller oysters are to die for!!!  We came in for late lunch on a weekday, so it was empty. The bartender was really attentive as well. When we come back to Pittsburg, we'll defenately coming back for those oysters!!

Ms1V17uO6vk06v-XyAnLqA.text: Overpriced tourist trap! Stay away! $40 "Hawaiian swordfish" came with soggy scallops and a bland sauce, salty mashed potatoes and greasy green beans. No thank you!  Truffle fries didn't remotely taste like truffle fries. Glass of wine I ordered came after I was done eating. Will not return!

ExnIK3hNkVQqpcYAq83JNQ.text: No matter the day, time or year they seriously disappoint. I've been a laundry club member which allows me to collect reward points for certain restaurants this location being one. Here at McCormicks they constantly fail to please me.  My Togo orders are always wrong, I'm never greeted when I enter the establishment. The waitstaff just look at me and make me feel uncomfortable. The food has gone down in taste. I'm tired of giving them low scores on their survey. I'm tired of the manger giving me a credit for my food. It's just sad. I use to love their blackened Alfredo I would substitute the chicken for shrimp. But it's just not good anymore .

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

lM2MQZ9be7mkTQrDqOrYNw.text: Meh-3.5 stars. Pricey for what you get, particularly in terms of portion size and sides. Many of the dishes are overly complicated. Service is ok, but MSSR has gone downhill over the years.

54Jj1uNkXKMdEq88jxfDWg.text: Exquisite. Easily one of the best dining experiences I've had. I came here with a friend on 10/6/18 before the Kansas concert. I had the lettuce wedge with Ranch dressing and it was perfect with Blue Cheese crumbles, bacon, and diced tomato. My main entree was the salmon rigatoni, which was pretty good. It needed a little more of a kick but some salt fixed it. The portion was good considering the price and should've been two meals, but I made it one. Finally, I had the chocolate cake for dessert (don't remember the name) and it came complete with a raspberry garnish, chocolate syrup sauce, and raspberry sauce garnish. Alex was our waitress, and she didn't miss a beat. Would definitely return.

QeX1r56xite2jgegkT51Mw.text: This review is for their bar/happy hour only. I came here recently with a friend for their happy hour, as they have really cheap food and drink specials (and ordinarily it's rather expensive to eat here). We got there shortly after 4:30 (when happy hour begins) and snagged one of the last tables....it quickly became standing-room only shortly thereafter. There was only one or maybe two servers taking care of the entire bar area, which was unfortunate given how crowded it was. Our poor waitress was very nice and apologetic, but it was just impossible for her to provide good service given how many tables she had to deal with. So the service was pretty abysmal...it took us a good 20 minutes to get our drinks. When she finally came back with our drinks, we ordered food from their happy hour menu...a burger for my friend and hummus and a chicken quesadilla for me. After about 20 minutes after placing our order, our waitress came back and said they didn't have hummus (bummer, but okay). Then...no exaggeration...we waited another HOUR for our food. We weren't in a hurry and had planned on staying awhile, so in the grand scheme of things, this wasn't a big deal. But I have no idea why it took an hour and 20 minutes to get our food. And when we did get our food? It was pretty terrible. I am usually a more forgiving critic when it comes to happy hour eats (I mean, I'm getting an appetizer for $5, so I try not to be too picky!), but this food was just not good at all. My quesadilla was cold, so the cheese was congealed on the inside. It was supposed to be a chicken quesadilla, but the meat was sparse and tasted cheap and low-quality. It came with a pico that was strangely dry. Also very strangely, the sour cream drizzled on top of the quesadilla was dry (I didn't even think that was possible....how can sour cream taste dry? But somehow it did). Honestly, it was probably the worst quesadilla I've ever eaten. My friend's burger meal wasn't any better...it was sloppily plated, cooked to a burnt texture, and her fries were cold. We both ended up giving up on our food after a few bites.  I know that M&S has a reputation for being a high-end restaurant, so I'm not sure why they would serve such cheap, low-quality food during their happy hour. Either way, between the poor service and the disappointing food, I don't think I'll be back here for happy hour any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy hour chicken quesadilla...quite possibly the worst quesadilla I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy hour burger and fries

OQ6W2rO9zNiWS3434L12QQ.text: I have been here many times for work lunches and there are a handful of dishes that are always solid (Parmesan crusted flounder, soups, fish tacos, halibut). But, maybe because it's a chain, I have always thought it was just "meh" for the most part. Some place pretty good and quick, but nothing to write home about.  In any event, came with my wife here for January 2018 restaurant week. The dinner was mostly just okay. You could sort of tell how they tried to cut corners on the restaurant week menu (which is a tad irritating because the deal is the only reason anyone was there for dinner).  For example, the crab soup was just a vegetable soup with a little crab thrown in there. The lobster sauce on the mashed potatoes was just their bisque soup base. My wife's steak medallions had to be sent back for very obviously being undercooked-- something that reflects inattentiveness and lack of attention to detail.  That said, much of the food was still good, like the lobster tails, potato hash, calamari. The desserts were decadent, as well. Mostly stuff you can't mess up. Service was good.  So, in the end, it was a pretty good but not a place I would be itching to go to, and I would probably Never come back here during restaurant week Again.

JQwR9kU4j3PQBbcCTAl6zQ.text: This place has really gone downhill. the food is really bad, save your money and go to Red Lobster, at least you will get cheesy biscuits.   The oysters were bad, smelled like a dirty diaper.

n9EKTtCzldBc4EXlUoBUzQ.text: Six of us on a Saturday night.  Libations and Food and Dessert - Oh my!  We started with beverages, Red Sangria and Spicy Tequila stole the show.  On the non-alcoholic side, they make a fabulous Arnold Palmer.  Appetizers:  Shrimp Kisses are a must, as are the fried artichoke hearts and the corn salsa.  We left not a morsel.  Bread: plentiful, fresh and so good - as was the wedge salad.  Manager David popped by to say hello and warmly welcome us to Mc&S.  But back to Anne - who kept us fed, watered, prepped and cleared.    Except for happy noises, we were only quiet during the main course consumption:  The Barramundi special was beautiful and proclaimed tasty.  Two of us chose the Scallops, they were quite large and disappeared.  Shrimp and steak with sweet potatoes, done perfectly.  Pasta for my daring Hubs - he loved it.  I chose the blackened Salmon with mashed potatoes and everything complimented the savory blackened flavoring very nicely. We were six happy campers.  But we didn't stop there...  Desserts to be shared!  upside down apple walnut pie with cinnamon ice cream.  And a bag of chocolate.  Yes, a dark chocolate, stand up "brown bag" filled with white chocolate mousse and topped with fresh fruits.  It was crazy good.  The Mc&S atmosphere is calm and upscale casual.  We could hear each other talking.  The staff is engaging and the prices are reasonable.  We had a great time sharing an evening at this high end chain - we will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Millionaire coffee
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Upside down apple pie
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bag of chocolate

5Z1DkqO62Dy6zQx5bCiyoA.text: Very poor meal. Caesar salad comparable to fast food. Chain like service. Way too expensive for quality.  Walk around corner to Capital Grill.

iwQ4-dgsZwPtlGhM57WfPA.text: It was pretty packed today and the bar area was busy, but this place has an awesome happy hour menu! On Tuesdays, you can get fish tacos for $2 a piece and a mexicatini for $5... totally worth stopping in. They also have a variety of other options on the happy hour menu.   I ended up getting the ahi tuna poke bowl and the crispy coconut shrimp. The bowl was delicious and the wontons were my favorite part! Didn't really taste much coconut in the cont shrimp, but they were still pretty good. The marmalade sauce made them extra special...yum! Highly recommend the mexicatini. Perfect summer drink!

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ahi tuna poke bowl and crispy coconut shrimp

ermWhmOBCDCL9WF_sVZEmA.text: I came here during their Happy Hour and I'm glad I did! Their Lemon Drop Martini ($7) happy hour special was absolutely delicious. I also got their calamari which came with jalapeno aioli sauce, and marinara sauce. For $5.99, their fried calamari was exceptional. The breading on the calamari is pretty light and frail, which I liked. They didn't taste unhealthily heavy and oily.   I haven't come during their regular hours yet, which I have yet to do so. Their happy hour doesn't get too busy until about 5:45pm. So if you're getting off work in downtown and need a quick drink, definitely stop  by here!

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lemon Drop Martini
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Calamari

GH-KkupBZiRBb_0MbfZC6A.text: Disappointing. Service was sub standard for Applebee's... oh wait! This is McCormick's! It took a while to be seated (who was in the front of the house? The same girl doing tables!? - weird). Then it took a long time just to get our drinks - wine and champagne for two. Bread came a long time after we were done with appetizers.   My husband's dish came without a black bean puree and some tiny underwhelming side roasted vegetables to feed a toddler. My food (salmon with peas/asparagus) tasted really good. My son's fish and chips were more like fish strips, he joked about not being able to tell the fish apart from the fries. My daughter's kids popcorn shrimp was a nice portion for a kids menu. We also had the fruit chocolate box, with raspberries and blueberries... no strawberry and very little fruit (only a few berries on the top. The mousse tasyef good and the chocolate was rich but the box itself was not that elegant, uneven sides.   I will not come back here... there are so many restaurants in the area, equally overpriced (my mini champagne bottle was $20) but at least the food is consistent and service is much better.

SA1p2snLl6o3yVieFhlj6g.text: Had lunch here this past week with some coworkers.  Everything from start to finish was perfect.  It was my first time eating here and I really liked the atmosphere it provided for lunch.  On top of that our service was fast and friendly.  For my meal I went with the American Kobe Style Burger.  The burger itself was cooked perfectly.  The meat was very tender and fresh.  The only issue with the burger was the way it was built.  The lettuce and tomatoes were placed underneath the patty which did not provide a solid base for the meat.  Because of this, the burger slid around and off of the bun several times.  This caused everything to become a little sloppy and required me to reconstruct the burger.  Despite this, it was still an incredible burger.  I had fries as my side with their homemade ranch which were also very good.    I would definitely stop back here to have another burger or to try some of their other options.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. American Kobe Style Burger

iFlGy_ghBJnSeHhr01zxNg.text: We decided to come here for happy hour before a show. They have a fairly long happy hour (4:30-7) and from what I saw online, it was a decent menu. We walked in around 4:50 and got to seats right in the center of the bar. Despite being in the center, with no drinks/ food in front of us, trying to grab the attention of the bartenders, we weren't able to even put in an order for at least 15 minutes. My boyfriend managed to wave one down after she checked on the man sitting next to us (for the second time since we had arrived). That was annoying.  I ordered a glass of their house cab and he got whiskey ginger. The price of the glass was probably the same as what you would get at cheaper restaurants. They also had featured cocktails on the menu. I later tried the proscecco sangria, but was not a big fan... too much ice and fruit, very little actual liquid in there. I'm glad I mostly had wine.   We also ordered a couple small plates to share. We were starving by the time we arrived, so we ordered the Jumbo shrimp cocktail, calamari, and truffle fries. Once we finally ordered, it wasn't long before our food came out. They accidentally brought us hummus instead of fries, but that was quickly replaced once we told our bartender the mistake. We ended up ordering the hummus later because it looked sooo good.  The shrimp was more expensive on the menu ($9) and came four pieces. I was a little surprised that it wasn't a half dozen, but regardless it was still really good. The calamari was my favorite. I love fried calamari. They gave us a jalapeno aioli to dip it in, and that was AWESOME. Great pairing. The fries were fine, but they were french fries, so it's not like the bar was set pretty high. Hummus was really good- if you're thinking of getting something like that, definitely get the hummus.   Our opinion of the bar ended up being redeemed once it got a little later and we ended up chatting with the bartender. I don't think I would've noticed how long it took to be greeted if I hadn't been so hungry and eager to place our food order. Everything else came at a fair pace, drinks refilled whenever empty, etc.  I think next time I'll be a little more strategic in what we order, and also prepared to wait a while.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. prosecco sangria
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. happy hour menu

3wAGWj4fPoEAt6MhLvat0A.text: Meh. Unnecessarily expensive is what I think of this place.   The service was very great! Everyone was really nice and I was able to get seated quickly with my date even though it was a Friday night.   The food is average -- nothing special. I do not think it is worth the price for what you pay. However, the fresh bread was very good and moist.

sLb73ryPnIWsw1D6CRPwqA.text: I went for lunch with my bestie during the week around 11:30.  We were sat immediately and our server acknowledged us with a smile on her face.  She offered us some bread while we looked at the menu.  To drink, I had a Arnold Palmer, which was not too sweet and delicious. To eat, I selected the Ultimate Mixed Grill...it came with red pepper mashed potatoes & green beans.  The food came out quickly but the mashed potatoes were a bit cold.  Everything else was a good temperature and the flavors were great.  My favorite was the lump crab cake and grilled shrimp.  Both were seasoned well, but the sauce for the crab cake really set it off.  The stuffed shrimp were ok, but I feel like they relied on the stuffing for flavor because the shrimp were plain and lacked flavor.  I'm not a fan of those.  Overall, it was a very good dish, and I would get it again (minus the stuffed shrimp).  The server was friendly and I would definitely return to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ultimate Grill

EfHUBm4RB_WOgF0OQ0mBEQ.text: Had a very nice dinner here on a Friday night. There was plenty of seating so we did not have to wait- the bar area was very full and I have heard they have good happy hour pricing/specials. I ordered the two lobster tails which were cooked well and came with a side of mash potatoes (my favorite part of the meal). My boyfriend opted for the filet which he enjoyed. I also thought my mojito was tasty and portioned well. Though this meal did not knock my socks off, it was good and I would return in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

urnmNodzhXcCEQLPjZHHng.text: Bummer man. Memorial Day and our first choice was sold out of the pearls of the sea. We found after a long walk this place and they had oysters.   So we ordered a doz and as soon  as they arrived I could smell something was wrong. On my second sniff I find the bad one and sent it back and they replaced it.   No problem the rest were fine.   But when getting some cocktail sauce from the cup we found remnants of a fried shrimp tail.  REALLY??  The manager came over and apologized profusely but really??  At a classy place you think they'd either comp the oysters or at least discount them. But not here.  It's almost a FU too bad.   So disappointed.   I should have known- it's a chain restaurant and it's all about volume not quality.  I used to think better of this place.   Really the smell of the bad oyster should have set off alarms 3 doors down.  And what manager wouldn't try to make up somehow for re-using condiments from previous table.

Wm_E1s8IpaL5gmpMdJW0tg.text: I come here a lot for happy hour because their 5-7pm weekday menu is awesome. I have also been to corporate events, and had great service every time.   I came to McCormick's last night on the tail end of happy hour (around 6:30) and was surprised by how less crowded I thought it would be. Our server seated the group with a smile. Even found a place to place a large suitcase a person in the group had. Everyone in the group had a delicious burger that were all cooked perfectly.   Great happy hour and spent less than 20 bucks!

8Nz3EDEQ51f7xYlhhlwPJw.text: We choose Landry's properties because we've come to expect a high quality experience. This dinner did not meet expectations, primarily on service. Food quality was okay but service was lacking. This was particularly disappointing as this was a 60th birthday dinner celebration. Our server was pleasant enough, just not present. We never received lemon for our water as requested. She never refilled our water or wine glasses. The manager never visited our table. And this on a night when only 3 tables total were in use in the restaurant. I don't think this is representative of all M&S locations, but this one should be avoided until upgrades in personnel are verified.

P7FBUqlAnxDyz1GZGxuyxg.text: This is our second time here. Early Saturday evening after a CLO performance is a great time to come. The restaurant was not crowded and the service was first rate. Our waiter was very helpful, suggesting we split a salad. My wife ordered the blue cobia and I ordered the mixed grill. Both of us were pleased with how our orders came out. While I've seen others have issues with the service, our meal was paced just right for us. The waiter was accessible and we did not want for refills, nor were we rushed or left waiting.   I definitely recommend eating here after a matinee at the Benedum.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The chocolate bag

ti5rdyd2Fn5dLDg3NIti-Q.text: I went to McCormick & Schmick's a while back when I saw them listed as a restaurant week option. I started with the soup which was good but it was just an average cup of soup. Nothing that blew me away. My boyfriend ended up getting the fried calamari and I was pleasantly surprised. It was a very large starter and it wasn't your traditional fried calamari. It had a variety of different things mixed in with the calamari. Obviously they were all fried so I wasn't able to make out what they all were but it was good none the less. I also really enjoyed that it was served with more of a sweet sauce. It wasn't served with marinara.  Entree wise both of us decided to go with the stuffed salmon. It looked really good on the menu and the waitress said it was her favorite dish but I sadly wasn't impressed. In my personal opinion I just didn't enjoy the Brie flavor mixed with the salmon. I love both separately but I wasn't loving them paired together. The mashed potatoes and green beans in the side were delicious however!  For our deserts we picked 1 cheesecake and 1 silk cake. As soon as I saw the "silk" cake coming out I thought things didn't look right with the cake. The waitress proceeded to set the plate down and the cake completely toppled over and the waitress thought nothing of it. I'm not sure what exactly we were served but it wasn't edible. You could barely get your spoon/fork to break a piece off. It was as if the cake had been frozen and then served as is. It was really disappointing and pretty shocking that no one else noticed anything wrong with it. We even took it home hoping it would thaw out but 48 hours later it was still hard as a rock.

zc74eYOEvDOeiCUsOKvmUw.text: Torn between 3 and 4 stars. I love seafood and they had so many options on the menu that I wanted to try. They have a lot of unique seafood. They allow you to substitute any sides to customize your dish.   My salad had a bit much cheese, but was delicious. I had the grilled salmon with brussel sprouts. Salmon was a bit dry, but still good. I prefer brussel sprouts to be crispy and they weren't, but they came mixed with other veggies such as beets which was delicious.   My meal was still good, but I would prefer something else next time.

Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Jec3ETrP0mdgZjRCcTYPLA.text: Not worth the price, down right bland food with slow service. I got the filet, stuffed shrimp, and potatoes. Meh, nothing I'd return for or want again. I picked at it. To be polite to who took me i got a left over box that I dont actually intend on eating. If I chop the steak up and season it maybe I can put it in an omelette tomorrow morning...

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potatoes and filet left overs... Meh
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My left overs I kind of took home to be polite

vJC7ZI00Xn1eIpyRKRY0Ig.text: There was more no about this visit than a yes. The no's started out when we were walking to the restaurant and were approached by panhandlers and a drunk guy who slammed into a medal pole and literally fell right on us. I know it's downtown but 6:00pm on a Sunday? Really? As we entered the restaurant the no's continued as we were led to  the private dining area. For our party of 23 they had set up many round tables instead of one long one. We have an annual family get together for Christmas at a different restaurant every year. Who wants to sit far away from each other? The reset took 1/2 an hour! Then more no's came with the crusty silverware, rotten mussels and overpriced appetizers. Four fried oysters were $12 and four fried razor thin scallops were $15. Two trays each for $54 total? Served on a bed of dry, store bought coleslaw? No! For my entree I ordered the center cut filet, mushrooms and asparagus. They were ok. Kind of a yes? Lobster tails were said to be okay also salmon was said to be good so more kind of a yes? We have no problem paying top notch prices at top notch restaurants but we expect top notch food for those prices. This restaurant is a wolf in sheep's clothing. Although service was a yes.
